cp510.assignments.geo_shape

Class GeoPlane

  • java.lang.Object
    • cp510.assignments.geo_shape.GeoPlane
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    uw.syp.java.tools.GWindowUser

    public class GeoPlane
extends java.lang.Object
implements uw.syp.java.tools.GWindowUser
    The GeoPlane class for UW java 510 assignment 4 (GeoShape part 1). The GeoPlane class handles the adding and removal of shapes. It has methods to add and remove shapes, as well as setters and getters for background color.
    Author:
    Toby Peterson.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GeoPlane

        public GeoPlane()
        The default constructor for GeoPlane. It sets the background color to medium gray (new Color(.5F,.5F,.fF)).

      • GeoPlane

        public GeoPlane(java.awt.Color color)
        The one-parameter constructor for GeoPlane. Sets the background color to a given color.
        Parameters:
        color - The given color.

    • Method Detail

      • show

        public void show()
        The show method for GeoPlane. Causes the plane to become visible. Any shapes stored in the list of shapes to draw will immediately be drawn.

      • getBitmap

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage getBitmap()
        The getBitmap method for GeoPlane. Note: I have been instructed to return null in this method due to issues with students calling the getBitmap method on GWindow.
        Returns:
        BufferedImage The bitmap bufferedImage of the encapsulated object.

      • addShape

        public void addShape(GeoShape shape)
        The addShape method for GeoPlane. Add a shape to the list of shapes to be drawn on the plane. Note that the shape is not immediately drawn; to force the shape to appear on the plane call the redraw method.
        Parameters:
        shape - A GeoShape object to help with adding a shape.

      • removeShape

        public GeoShape removeShape(GeoShape shape)
        The removeShape method for GeoPlane Removes the given shape from the list of shapes to draw on the plane. The removed shape will continue to appear on the plane until the plane is redrawn. If the shape is found and removed the shape object is returned; if the shape is not found null will be returned.
        Parameters:
        shape - The shape to remove.
        Returns:
        The GeoShape object needing removal.

      • getShapes

        public java.util.List<GeoShape> getShapes()
        The getShapes method for GeoPlane.
        Returns:
        The list (geoList) containing the shapes to display on the plane.

      • redraw

        public void redraw(java.awt.Graphics2D gtx)
        The redraw (1 parameter) method for GeoPlane. Calls the draw(Graphics2D) method for all shapes in the list of shapes.
        Specified by:
        redraw in interface uw.syp.java.tools.GWindowUser
        Parameters:
        gtx - The graphical parameter used for draw.

      • redraw

        public void redraw()
        The redraw (0 parameters) method. It explicitly draws the shapes in the list of shapes. Calling this method has no effect if the plane is not visible.

      • getBackgroundColor

        public java.awt.Color getBackgroundColor()
        The getBackgroundColor getter method for GeoPlane. Returns the background color of this GeoPlane.
        Returns:
        Color The given background color for the object.

      • setBackgroundColor

        public void setBackgroundColor(java.awt.Color color)
        The setBackgroundColor setter for GeoPlane. Sets the background color of this GeoPlane to the given color. The background color will not physically change until the plane is redrawn.
        Parameters:
        color - The background color to set for the shape.
